meanings.definition: One who contradicts or denies something.
meanings.sent1: The contradicter disagreed with everything I said.
meanings.sent2: She always plays the contradicter in our debates.
meanings.sent3: The contradicter at the meeting kept shaking their head in disagreement.
meanings.sent4: His sister was a contradicter, always challenging his opinions.
meanings.sent5: The contradicter's constant opposition made it hard to have a productive discussion.

meanings.definition: To assert the contrary or opposite of; deny directly and categorically.
meanings.sent1: He would always contradict her, no matter what she said.
meanings.sent2: Don't contradict her, just listen to what she has to say.
meanings.sent3: The child loved to contradict his parents just for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her actions seemed to contradict her words, causing confusion.
meanings.sent5: The witness's statement contradicted the evidence presented in court.
